result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex Martin Ware not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Alex Martin Ware.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a return on Doctor's report. Defendant not present for today's hearing. Defendant is in custody at the WRC. Court reviewed the report and adopts the findings into the record. Parties does not contest the findings of the report. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed.
for Commitment, signed and filed

records.descr: Order Submitted in PDF Format Declined
DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex Martin Ware in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Alex Martin Ware in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 15. Competency hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Devin Randle under the supervison of Dr. Thomas DeBoer. Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Devin Randle u Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. FORTHWITH. 
Court orders case adjourned  back to Branch 15 for Competency Review Hearing  Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Alex Martin Ware in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Alex Martin Ware in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     
Case in court for return on doctors report. Parties in receipt of examiner's report dated.  Defendant stands mute. Court ordered case set for  a competency hearing.  
Contested doctors report hearing affirmed with teh examiner. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Court is in receipt of email from DHSstating  defendant will be  admitted on 7/ 8 and scheduled hearing on  7-14-2022 will not be enough time to submit a report,.
Court ordered matter adjourned. Parties notified. new date confirmed with defense via email. 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled July 25, 2022 at 8:30am.

for Competency Examination, signed and filed.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Alex Martin Ware not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference.
Court is in receipt of the Examiner's letter stating defendant was uncooperative and could not conduct the examination. 
Defense advises the court he did attempted to the speak with the defendant while in custody but defendant did not respond to him. 
Court asked defendant questions but he remained mute.  
Court orders the defendant remanded into the custody of she sheriff to be transported to the one of the two state mental health institutes  FORTHWITH for in patient evaluation.
Case adjourned for return on doctors report in Branch 19.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Case rescheduled off the record in Br. 30 due to judge unavailability. Case rescheduled back to Br. 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Alex Martin Ware not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense could not meet with their client at the jail for reasons setforth on the record and requests an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on doctor's report. The competency report is inconclusive, and the Court asked the Defense to speak with their client. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

PATRICK WAIT
forwarded to the Judge.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Alex Martin Ware in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Alex Martin Ware in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alex Martin Ware appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls any applicable time limits.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
